description.p: The Circle of Leth and their force of Nentyar Hunters have protected the Dalesfolk and the forests of the land for hundreds of years.
This group is overseen by the Nentyarch, an archdruid of remarkable power who oversees these groups from an old wood elf stronghold at Yeshelmaar in the Forest of Lethyr.

As a Nentyarch Follower you respect the Circle of Leth. You believe in the sanctity of the great forests surrounding the Dale and you hope to purge the land of the fiendish hosts that still infect it. Honest people of the Dale should be protected, but the spread of civilization shouldn’t call for the felling of further forest. Nature itself needs protection from the depredations of those who do not place enough value on its continued existence.

ul.li: Tool Proficiencies: One artisan tool of your choice
Equipment: A hunting knife, a healer’s kit, a set of traveler’s clothes, a sprig of mistletoe, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp.

description.p: As a Nentyarch Follower, you believe in protecting the people of the Great Dale and the sanctity of nature.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: If the Dalesfolk are threatened, I will do whatever I can to help them.
The comforts of civilization are nice, but the majesty of nature is a wonder to behold.
I always explain my ideas by relating them to something in nature.
Being polite is a waste of time.
I believe in the interconnectedness of all life.
I have trouble paying attention when there are lots of people around.
I am incredibly patient.
I believe actions speak louder than words.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Balance. Balance is important in all things. Excess in any direction leads to weakness. (Neutral)
Power. In the wild, the weak are culled and the strong survive. (Evil)
Independence. The peoples of the Great Dale should be free to live the life they choose. (Chaotic)
Nature. The lands will outlast us all. They are more important than our fleeting creations. (Neutral)
Integrity. My word is my bond. (Lawful)
Charity. It is right to help those who are in distress. The greater the need, the greater the call to help. (Good)

select.name: Bond
select.item: The Circle of Leth saved my village. I am forever indebted to them.
My village was destroyed by demons. They will be avenged.
I’ve lived in this place all my life. I will do everything I can to protect it.
I protect those who cannot protect themselves.
Although I am new to this land, I feel I need to do my part to make it a safer place.
I’ve seen forests cleared to fill a noble’s pocket with coin. I intend to make sure that never happens again.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I’m a fraud. There’s no way I can live up to people’s expectations.
I’d prefer to stay alone in the woods then to deal with people.
I don’t understand the value of money.
I believe that the ends justify the means.
I cannot resist the temptations of civilization and overindulge in its pleasures.
I don’t trust anyone, not even my closest friends.

description.p: The Nentyarch and the Circle of Leth have long looked after the people of the Great Dale. You can find a place to hide, rest, or recuperate within any of the many small villages or farmsteads that exists in the Great Dale and the Forest of Lethyr, provided you have not shown yourself to be a danger to them. They will shield you from anyone who might oppose the Nentyarch or anyone else searching for you, though they will not risk their lives for you.
